name: Ellipsis Issue 1
description: “A wry yet heartfelt examination of the subtext whenever anyone says ‘the journey’s more important than the destination’” - Kieron Gillen (Phonogram, Journey into Mystery) El•lip•sis (noun) From Ancient Greek (elleipsis) to leave out, fall short 1. A mark or series of marks used to indicate an intentional omission, unfinished thought or a trailing off into silence. The ellipsis can also inspire a feeling of melancholy or longing. 2. A sudden leap from one topic to another. 3. A comic composed of six standalone but interconnected short stories by Tom Humberstone Issue 1/6 Pregnant Pause. A young woman contemplates the transient and incongruous nature of airports as she begins a new chapter of her life. 24 pages with a die-cut cover. NOW AVAILABLE FOR PRE-ORDER The first 100 pre-orders receive an additional signed and numbered A5 colour print. Select the "With sketch" option to receive your copy signed and with a unique sketch by the artist. Half page. Fully inked. Images can be requested by using the Contact link and emailing Solipsistic Pop Books. Download a PDF Press Release. Published on July 27th 2012 by Solipsistic Pop Books, London ISBN 978-0-9570519-1-1

name: Ellipsis (subscription)
description: “A wry yet heartfelt examination of the subtext whenever anyone says ‘the journey’s more important than the destination’” - Kieron Gillen (Phonogram, Journey into Mystery) El•lip•sis (noun) From Ancient Greek (elleipsis) to leave out, fall short 1. A mark or series of marks used to indicate an intentional omission, unfinished thought or a trailing off into silence. The ellipsis can also inspire a feeling of melancholy or longing. 2. A sudden leap from one topic to another. 3. A comic composed of six standalone but interconnected short stories by Tom Humberstone This subscription ensures you receive every issue before anyone else and entitles you to additional print incentives, original artwork and more. The subscription exists as a way to provide a 'readership advance' for the artist to focus exclusively on the series. More about this has been written here. Subscribe to Ellipsis to receive: - All 6 issues of the comic before they are released in stores. Signed and with a sketch. Each issue will ship every six months. - All postage and packing included in the initial cost (International subscribers pay slightly more in order to contribute to shipping costs). - Digital copies of each comic. - Every additional, signed and numbered print incentive that comes with each issue (while stocks last - if prints have sold out, an alternative sketch/postcard will be provided). - The collected edition of the comic. - A newsletter with updates on Ellipsis. - Exclusive opportunities to purchase and win original art from the series. Download a PDF Press Release of Issue 1.

name: Solipsistic Pop Five
description: Book Five of Solipsistic Pop will be a book entirely devoted to comics journalism. Presenting a portrait of the UK in 2012 with long-form comics from a selection of established and upcoming comic artists. Featured artists: Badaude / Darryl Cunningham / Edward Ross / Anne Holiday / Tom Humberstone / Rebecca Truscott Elves / Isabel Greenberg / Robert Brown / Andrew Waugh / Martin Simpson / Kyle Fox / Liz Greenfield / John Miers Plus a cover illustrated and designed by Kristyna Baczynski. Due for publication Spring 2013

name: Solipsistic Pop Four
description:
Book Four of Solipsistic Pop is the largest and most ambitious volume yet – with 80 pages, 30 artists, a larger print-run of 1,000, and extensive interactive material that makes full use of the joy of the printed artefact.

The theme for Book Four is Maps and each contributor has created a comic inspired by the visual vocabulary of cartography, circuit diagrams and flowcharts.

A large folder designed by John Miers houses the book and additional elements - including three postcards that have been specially printed to encourage the reader to travel with their comics. A local-area bingo checklist by Oliver East, a glow-in-the-dark comic by Takayo Akiyama, and a plantable seeded comic by Jenny Robins.

A wraparound book cover by Stephen Collins is protected by a large A2 poster/dustjacket designed by Katie Green.

Featured artists: Takayo Akiyama / Kristyna Baczynski / Dan Berry / Joe Blann / Stephen Collins / Paul Harrison Davis / Joe Decie / John Cei Douglas / Oliver East / Nick Edwards / Marc Ellerby / Paul Francis, Katie Green / Isabel Greenberg / Howard Hardiman / Ste Hitchen / Tom Humberstone / Joe List / Lizz Lunney / John Miers / Kathryn Newman / Luke Pearson / Philippa Rice / Jenny Robins / Edward Ross / Alison Sampson / Anna Saunders / Matthew Sheret

ISBN: 978-0-9570519-0-4

name: Solipsistic Pop Three
description:
Book three of Solipsistic Pop contains 80 pages of comic art created to be accessible to readers of all ages. 30 exclusive stories from 26 of the best comic artists, illustrators and designers working in the UK today. Includes a free Solipsistic Pop pencil to create your own comic and an A3 poster with re-peelable stickers.

Contributions from Kristyna Baczynski, Becky Barnicoat, Adam Cadwell, Warwick Johnson Cadwell, Francessca Cassavetti, Faz Choudhury, David O’Connell, Darryl Cunningham, Rob Davis, Joe Decie, John Cei Douglas, Marc Ellerby, Sarah Gordon, Anne Holiday, Tom Humberstone, Daniel Locke, Lizz Lunney, Mark Oliver, Luke Pearson, Octavia Raitt, Edward Ross, Philippa Rice, Anna Saunders, Julia Scheele, Tom Smith, and Andrew Waugh.

name: Solipsistic Pop Two
description:
Book two of Solipsistic Pop contains 64 pages of sequential art from some of the best comic artists, illustrators and designers working in the UK today. With a 12 page newspaper insert, gorgeous gatefold cover and specially designed tote bag, it’s a must have for any comic fan.

Contributions from Kristyna Baczynski, Becky Barnicoat, Adam Cadwell, Stephen Collins, Joe Decie, Marc Ellerby, Sally Hancox, Anne Holiday, Tom Humberstone, Philippa Johnson, Daniel Locke, Lizz Lunney, Jack Noel, Mark Oliver, Luke Pearson, Octavia Raitt, Anna Saunders, Julia Scheele, Matthew Sheret, and Matilda Tristram.

name: Solipsistic Pop One
description: “You know nothing about the following pages. It’s possible that, as you turn these pages, your life will change forever” – Kieron Gillen from his introduction Book one of Solipsistic Pop includes two hand-bound mini-comics and a 16 page newspaper insert – all enclosed within a 56 page, full colour book. Contributions from Andrew Blundell, Anna Saunders, Daniel Locke, Howard Hardiman, Joe Decie, Julia Scheele, Mark Oliver, Matthew Sheret, Philip Spence, Philippa Jonhson, Rachael Reichert, Richard Cowdry, Robbie Wilkinson, Sarah Gordon, Stephen Collins, and Tom Humberstone
